p: In the year of 1722,

the Kangxi Emperor
of the Qing Dynasty passed away.

Nian Gengyao,
Governor-General of Chuan-Shan,

and Longkodo,
Commander of the Nine Gates,

both played a role in the struggle
over imperial succession

and were key to helping the Fourth Prince,
Yinzhen, ascend to the throne.

Accordingly, the new Emperor
held them in high esteem

and granted them
unequaled political power.

They soon became central figures
in the new government.
THE YONGZHENG EMPEROR
All kneel!

p.span: Lotus blossoms spring up on every side.
They bloom and wither, time after time,
just as the concubines of the palace.
"Each year and every year,
the blossoms return anew.
Each year and every year,
the bloom of youth does not."
After the Yongzheng Emperor
ascended the throne,
he accomplished many great feats.
However, he did not have many sons.
Concerned that there would not be
enough male heirs to secure the throne,
the Empress Dowager held auditions
to fill the Imperial Harem
every three years.
Every girl wished to be selected,
so that her whole family
could rise up through her success.
But I didn't hope for that.
My only wish was
"to capture the heart of my fated lover
and cling together
till our hair turns gray."
However, much changes over time.
No one could expect
what would happen at the audition.
As a pious girl, I am not allowed
great achievements like men,
but neither am I willing
to discard my own life.
If I must marry someone,
only the finest of men
will be my choice.
I will marry him and remain
by his side as long as I live.
May Buddha grant me this blessing,
let me be passed over
for service in the Imperial Harem.

p: ZHEN HUAN
SHANGSHAN TEMPLE

My lady,
all other girls want to be chosen.
Only you wish to be passed over.
LIUZHU – HUANBI

The Buddha will surely
remember your prayers.

Don't say it aloud
or it will not come true.
WEN SHICHU

Is today a festival day?
Even Doctor Wen has come to the temple.

- Shichu.
- Huan.
I just checked up on your family.

Your mother told me
you'd come here to offer incense.

Simply for a stroll
and to pass an idle hour.
Huan, don't try to hide it from me.

I know you've been worried
about the audition for many days.

I may only do what I'm allowed.
The rest I leave to fate.

Huan, when my father lived,
he often said,

"A jade vessel
is the symbol of a pure heart."
He wanted me to give this to my future–
It is my own wish as well.

If you accept this,
you won't be called to the audition.

In the time of the Shunzhi Emperor,
it was decreed

that girls qualified to join the harem
may not marry before the audition.

Though you intend to help, you need not
give me such a valuable item.
I'm profoundly flattered.

Huan, I'm merely an imperial doctor
with the means of a humble official,

but I promise to cherish you
for as long as I live,

to love you, protect you
and place you above all else.

Although you may find
my words imprudent,

I truly hope you are passed over
at the audition.

My father was once implicated
due to strife in the harem.

He was unable
to preserve his good name.

If this can befall
even an imperial doctor,
then a concubine will not be spared.
I understand your concern.

But if I don't take part now,
my sister Yurao must do so eventually.
My parents have no sons.

I have no choice
but to perform my filial duty.

- Mei.
- Huan.
SHEN MEIZHUANG

I heard you were summoned
but hadn't had a chance to greet you.
I had hoped for the opposite.

Now you have a residence
here in the capital
and no longer live with your grandparents.

- Now we may visit one another often.
- Absolutely.

I often remember with fondness
the bond we shared growing up together.
You dressed quite plainly today.

Even so, the observant
will notice your true beauty.
It cannot be hidden.
THE EMPRESS DOWAGER

Xia Ruhua, daughter of the Magistrate
of Jiaxing County, is passed over.
Bestow the flower.
What family are you from?

How can you pour hot tea on me?
You must be punished!

- I'm sorry.
- Answer me! Who is your father?
AN LINGRONG

My name is An Lingrong.
My father–

My father is An Bihuai,
Deputy Magistrate of Songyang County.

I knew you were from
a humble family of the provinces.

I, Lingrong, am at fault.
Please forgive me.
XIA DONGCHUN
I may forgive you,

but you must first bow down
and beg for my forgiveness.

Only then will I show clemency,
this once.
On your knees.
It's only a dress.

I know you are kind and generous.
You mustn't be angered by trifles.
Who are you?

My father is Zhen Yuandao,
Deputy Chief of the Grand Court of Review.

Deputy Chief of the Grand Court
is not a high-ranking office.

Rank is of no importance.
Justice is all that matters.

They now audition the Han Army
of the Eight Banners.
Your behavior may disturb His Majesty.

If His Majesty vents his wrath,
there is no way for us to make amends.

It will also tarnish the reputation
of the Han Banners.

Such behavior does more harm than good.
I hope you think twice.

- Are you all right?
- Thank you for intervening.

I will never forget your kindness
as long as I live.
Think nothing of it.

How do you dare act so brashly
even within the Imperial Palace?

- And you are–
- This is Meizhuang.
Please accept my greetings, Meizhuang.
No need to be so courteous.
"The clothing completes the person."

It's true everywhere in the world
without exception.

You dressed simply but elegantly.
No wonder they looked down on you.

I give you these earrings as a gift
to commemorate our first meeting.
No, no.

May your wishes come true and
may you enjoy the fruits of success.
I thank you for your generosity,
but I was born into a humble family.
I may not be able to repay your kindness.
"Birth is much but breeding is more."

You're a beauty.
Do not begrudge yourself that.

An Lingrong, daughter of An Bihuai,
Deputy Magistrate of Songyang County.
Age, sixteen.

An Lingrong bows in respect before
His Majesty and the Empress Dowager.
May blessings and peace be with you.

You are passed over.
Bestow the flower.

I'm grateful to Your Majesty
and the Empress Dowager.

May Your Majesty and Your Highness
enjoy health and happiness forever.

Others showed displeasure
when they were passed over,

but your response
was filled with courtesy.

Being allowed to meet
Your Majesty and Your Highness
is the highest honor indeed.

The begonia in your hair
is quite elegant.

Queen Mother, no need to bestow a flower,
since she already wears one in her hair.

An Lingrong is selected.
Bestow the sachet.
That one.

Xia Dongchun, daughter of Xia Wei,
Captain of the Imperial Guard.
Age, eighteen.

Her name is intriguing.
She is selected.
Thank you, Your Majesty.

Shen Meizhuang, daughter of Shen Zishan,
Colonel of Jizhou Garrison.
Age, seventeen.

Shen Meizhuang bows in respect before
His Majesty and the Empress Dowager.

May Your Majesty
enjoy long life and blessings.

May Your Highness
enjoy good health and peace.
Have you read any books?

I am slow and can barely read, only
Rules for Women and Advice for Women.

Most girls have only mastered
the arts of sewing and embroidery.

It is truly impressive
that you are able to read.
I thank Your Majesty and Your Highness.
Write down her name.

Shen Meizhuang is selected.
Bestow the sachet.

Zhen Huan, daughter of Zhen Yuandao,
Deputy Chief of the Grand Court of Review.
Age, seventeen.

Zhen Huan, daughter of Zhen Yuandao,
Deputy Chief of the Grand Court of Review.
Age, seventeen.

Zhen Huan bows in respect before
His Majesty and the Empress Dowager.
May blessings and peace be with you.

Zhen Huan, with which character
do you write the name "Huan"?

"Huan huan" once described the slim waist
of the concubines of the Chu palace.
It's from a poem by Cai Shen.
Yes, sir.

You are versed in poetry and literature.
Zhen Yuandao raised his daughter well.

I only wonder if you're a match
for such an auspicious name.
Lift your head.
Come forward.
Fairly decent.

"Beauties of slim waist in the Chu palace
are quite graceful and charming.

But their youth and beauty
will fade away with the years."
The Forbidden City is a nourishing place.
Your youth and beauty will never fade.
Those who would stay must leave,

and those who would leave
must stay forever.

Many girls dream of being selected
for the harem. Do not be sad.

Besides, we've both been selected.
We can take care of each other.

Mei, it was truly not my wish
to be selected.
Yes, but it is heaven's wish.

You will not be granted an ordinary life
when you can live an extraordinary one.
Congratulations, Your Majesty.

Several fine beauties
will be added to the harem.

Among the ordinary ones, it's
pleasing that one or two are acceptable.
More than acceptable.

I've heard Shen Zishan's daughter
quite resembles the young Concubine Jing.
THE EMPRESS
And Zhen is practically identical to–
She's somewhat similar around the eyes.
Somewhat similar is already quite enough.
Please forgive my curiosity.
But which rank will you grant to Zhen?

Sixth rank, First Attendant.
We will call her "Wan."
CONSORT HUA
First Attendant Wan?

Yes, my lady. Daughter of Zhen Yuandao,
Deputy Chief of the Grand Court.
Among the newly selected concubines,

she was the only one given an
honorific name, but her rank is not high.

The one who made a display
of her eloquence at the audition?
Yes, my lady. Exactly.

Was it His Majesty's decision
to allot Chengqian Palace to her?

His Majesty wasn't involved.
It was decided by the Empress.
Chengqian Palace is a wondrous place.

Not only spacious and magnificent,
but also near His Majesty's Yangxin Hall.

The Empress always knows
how to please His Majesty.

She will do anything
to curry favor with His Majesty.
ZHOU NINGHAI – SONGZHI
Is there another palace available?

Yes, there is. Suiyu Pavilion,
where Lady Fang used to reside.
It is clean and exquisite,

but it's a bit remote, a bit distant,
and a bit small.
Besides, it's considered unpropitious.
Unpropitious?

Just because Lady Fang was sent
to the Cold Palace after miscarriage?
I see no reason for such taboos.
Your Highness,

Consort Hua has changed the residence
of Attendant Wan to Suiyu Pavilion.
I pity her.

Consort Hua is domineering.
She decided without even asking your view.
JIANQIU

It's not the first time you've met
Consort Hua. She has always acted so.

But His Majesty loves her
exactly as she is.
Another strand of gray hair.

I bow to Your Majesty.
May good fortune be with you.

Where is Consort Hua?
Why didn't she come to greet me?

Your Majesty,
my lady was indisposed today.
She went to bed early.
In that case, I'll leave.

I must meet with Consort Qi
and the Third Prince.

Leave now, and you'll never again
pass through the gates of Yikun Palace.

Hypocrite.
You grow even more capricious.

Your Majesty hasn't
called on me for a while.
I assumed you had forgotten me.
You're the only one

who dares behave so recklessly
in my presence.
So fragrant.

Your Majesty grants Huanyi Incense
to me exclusively and I use it every day.
Yes, I truly love the fragrance.
The others don't have it.
FANGRUO

Bow to the young mistresses.
May good fortune be with you.

- This is–
- The side door to Shunzhen Gate.

Concubines must enter the palace
by going through the side door.

Only the Empress is allowed
to enter through the main gate.
Mei.

Young mistress,
now is not the time to converse.

The eunuchs will lead you
to your residences.
It's getting late.

The Imperial Household Department has
delivered your belongings to your palaces.

Young mistresses,
please enter the palace.
It seems so deserted.

It's not deserted.
It's peaceful and quiet.

Good, our young mistress
loves peace and quiet.

Kang Luhai, lead eunuch of Suiyu Pavilion,
bows in respect before Attendant Wan.
KANG LUHAI
May you enjoy happiness and good fortune.

Cui Jinxi, lead maid of Suiyu Pavilion,
bows in respect before Attendant Wan.
CUI JINXI
May good fortune be with you.
Please rise.

- Yes, mistress.
- Thank you, First Attendant.
From now on, you are all my servants.
I expect each of you to do your part.
Loyalty should always come first.
Yes, mistress.
Will you remember that?

We promise to be loyal to you
without a second thought.
Rewards.
We are at your service.

Young mistress, you must be tired.
Please rest.
YANXI PALACE

I'm flattered. The Empress sent you
to bring the gifts personally.
It's an honor.

Think nothing of it.
Now I must excuse myself.
Farewell then.
I'll see myself out.

You come from a humble family.
No wonder others treat you poorly.

Such meager gifts.
You have my sympathies.

Gifts from Consort Hua
can't compare to those from the Empress.

Make a dress from the fabric
the Empress gave us right away.

I'll wear it to
the first official audience
with the Empress to show my gratitude.
Yes, mistress.
BAOJUAN

She always acts like this.
Who can bear it?
SUIYU PAVILION
I now live in Xianfu Palace.

The palace mistress is Concubine Jing.
She is kind and accommodating.
And for you?
As for me,
Lady Fucha doesn't seem overbearing.
But First Attendant Xia–
I'll just ignore her.
I'll only talk with you two.

By the way, you didn't bring
any private servants with you.
Have the imperial maids served you well?
Baojuan is smart, she's a reliable one.

The other two young maids
are only fifteen.
I don't expect much from them.

But it's fine, I'm used to a simple life.
It doesn't matter at all.
Jinxi.
Yes, mistress.
Go tell the Empress

that I'm sending Juqing to Yanxi Palace
to serve Attendant An instead.
Yes, mistress.

Juqing may be young,
but she is loyal and reliable.

You may take her with you
when you return.

If you need anything else,
just feel free to ask me or Mei.
Thank you.

I just received some satin today,
and I think it'll suit you well.

I'll ask Caiyue to take it
to Yanxi Palace.

You two treat me so kindly.
It's more than I can return.

What you have done for me
is greatly appreciated.

The three of us
entered the palace together,
and we know each other very well.

Of course we should
take care of each other.
JIANG FUHAI

All young mistresses must perform
the formal salutation to the Empress.

Your Highness the Empress,
may blessings and peace be with you.
You may rise.
Thank you, Your Highness.
Please also greet the other concubines.

All young mistresses
must bow in respect before Consort Hua.

May blessings and peace
be with you, my lady.
You may rise.
Thank you, my lady.
I hear that Attendant Xia is quite clever.

May blessings and peace
be with you, my lady.

I'm a First Attendant
from the Xia family.
Attendant Xia dresses very well.

Your dress is made
from expensive material, isn't it?

It was a gift from
Her Highness the Empress.

I specifically chose this dress
for today's audience.

I see that you know how to show gratitude,
you are kindhearted.
Rise.
Thank you, my lady.

Which ones are Lady Shen
and Attendant Wan?

I am Lady Shen of Xianfu Palace.
I bow in respect before Consort Hua.

I'm Zhen Huan of Suiyu Pavilion.
I bow in respect before Consort Hua.
Lady Shen is quite elegant and graceful.

Attendant Wan
has dressed a little plainly,
but her beauty cannot be concealed.

His Majesty has a keen eye
for spotting a true beauty.
Each of these is outstanding.
All right, rise.
Thank you, Consort Hua.

My lady, you are the true beauty
of the nation, drawing all attention.

Your radiance is superior to ours.
We dare not compete with the Consort.
Your words are sweet indeed.
But the phrase "beauty of the nation,"
isn't that reserved for the Empress?

Her Highness the Empress
glows as bright as the moon.

Consort Hua's beauty
sparkles like a shining pearl.

We are not capable
of being compared with you.

I see there are more and more
clever tongues in the Imperial Harem.
You two really do have clever tongues.

After pleasing the Empress,
you start flattering Consort Hua.

You put on a show before everyone
to curry favor with both sides.
Truly admirable.
I bow in respect before Attendant Xia.

You've both asked your servants
to carry so many gifts.
Do you have enough room to keep them?

We intend to share
all the imperial favors we've received.

I planned to send some to your residences
after returning to my palace.
But since we've met here,
please pick out whatever you like.
Attendant Xia, please choose first.

My family's residence
is already filled with such decorations.

But surely Lady Shen will bestow
some small charity on you.

It seems she's quite good
at catering to others.

How was someone like her selected?
There's not a bit of good in her.

The Xia family is not even on a par
with the servants of the Nian family.
Look at her dress.

She thinks she can swagger around
because of the Empress' support.

On the day of the audition,
I accidentally offended you.

I haven't stopped thinking
about my mistake, and I am sorry for it.
Since you're from a military family,

you are surely endowed
with civil and martial virtues.

As I expected,
you're truly resolute and brave.

You will surely bring honor
to your family's name.
That's exactly how I was brought up.

Such stupidity
actually exists in the world.

But she was granted
the rank of First Attendant.
Yes, my lady.

You're a concubine, just like her.
You cannot hit her.
Let go of me!

May blessings and peace
be with you, Consort Hua.
Consort Hua.
Zhou Ninghai, let her go.

In early fall, the Imperial Garden
is as beautiful as a picture,

but the magnificent prospect
is tainted by someone.
What a disappointment.
Second Attendant An tried to insult me.
I just wanted to teach her a lesson.
That's all.
Are the Empress and I no longer present?

I didn't know that Attendant Xia
had been put in charge of the harem,

taking on the duty
of instructing the others.

I'm afraid you're not qualified
to take up this responsibility.

The red hue of the maple
isn't very striking this year.

They say the maple turns brilliant red
if dyed with a little blood.
Is that true?

Then I will award Attendant Xia
the Scarlet Red

so that we may add some red color
to the maples with her blood.
The Scarlet Red?

Young mistress, the Scarlet Red
is a kind of punishment in the harem.

A beating with a wooden board
that is two cun thick and six chi long,

until bone and tendon are broken,
and the flesh is badly lacerated.

From a distance, you will see a patch
of vibrant red, a most beautiful color.

For that reason,
it is called the Scarlet Red.
Young mistress, please come with me.
Consort Hua, spare me!
Spare me!

Now, take her
to the Office of Punishment.
Consort Hua, spare me!
Consort Hua!
Consort Hua, spare me!

Xia disrespected her superiors
and acted in a reckless manner.
You may very well be startled.

However, though you may not
have violated any rules,

it was you three who stirred up
this whole incident.

Shut yourselves away
and reflect on your mistakes.
I was scared to death.

Xia was stupid and arrogant,
but her punishment was excessive.

I knew that Consort Hua was formidable,
but never imagined to this extent.

Consort Hua ordered us
to reflect on our mistakes.

Just to reflect on our mistakes.
No need to be afraid.
What's the matter?
What happened?
Young mistress, I was on my shift.

I went to check the water level
in each well of the Imperial Garden.

As soon as I arrived,
I saw that the well–
I will go see for myself.
Fuzi?
How did a maid fall into a well?
I don't know.

The place is quite remote,
people seldom pass by.
Of course you wouldn't know.

It was I who appointed Fuzi
to serve Consort Hua.
Rise.
I have one more item to report.
Speak.

Consort Hua has punished Attendant Xia
with the Scarlet Red.
Xia was irritating. She deserved it.

I'm terribly sorry for Fuzi.
She died for nothing.
She was a mere serving girl.
What connections does Fuzi have?
Am I not allowed to scold her?

She is just a humble servant.
She doesn't have any connections.
I see.

The other day, she hurt me
in clumsiness while combing my hair.
I scolded her for it.

She cried out and ran away.
She hasn't come back ever since.

I thought that was how the Empress
disciplined her servants.
My lady, Fuzi is dead.
Dead?
How did she die?
When did it happen?

Her body was just pulled from the well.
It was badly swollen.

It was surely the day you scolded her.
She cried and ran off afterwards.

She was careless and fell in the well.
Right, Jiang Fuhai?
My lady, I dare not speak.
Why not?
Eunuch,

are you implying that
someone pushed her from behind?

- I wouldn't dare.
- No matter!

If you won't take my word,
you may investigate all my servants.
My lady, you exaggerate.
Let's speak plainly.

I'm sure you came here today
by order of the Empress.

You've asked your questions,
I've answered, and I have witnesses, too.
You may take them with you if you wish.

Otherwise, if you come to me
with this matter again,
I will absolutely crush you.
My lady, I'll excuse myself now.
Idiot! How careless!
All of you must remember.

Fuzi ran off by her own choice,
slipped into the well and drowned.
Yes, sir.

Young mistress,
you've had a severe shock.
I saw something I shouldn't have.
Then you must find a way to forget it.

That day we met outside the palace,
you made me a promise. Is it still valid?

Of course.
I'll always place you above all else.
I'm at your command.
I refuse to serve His Majesty in bed.
It is against my wishes as well.

But since you're already here,
it is only a matter of time.

For the sake of your future,
it should happen as soon as possible.

But I'm really scared.
If I serve His Majesty at this time–

I know I am not destined
to spend the rest of my life with you,

but keeping you from harm
for the rest of your life
is another way to keep my promise.

Since you want good repose
to make a full recovery,
I'll prepare a special prescription

which will restore you to health
in some time.
Your Majesty, please select a concubine.
Where's the name board for Attendant Wan?
Your Majesty,

the Imperial Medical Bureau
reported this afternoon

that Attendant Wan suffered a shock
which has led her to fall ill.
She needs isolation and rest.
Suffered a shock?

Consort Hua's servant Fuzi
fell into the well for unknown reasons.

Attendant Wan
saw the dead body by accident.
Consort Hua.
LADY SHEN
Congratulations, Lady Shen.

His Majesty has chosen you
to serve him in bed.
Among the newly selected concubines,

you're the first to win
His Majesty's favor.
But I–

This is Madam Liu, who is in charge
of the imperial bedchamber.

Young mistress,
she will tell you all the rules.

Shortly after, the Imperial Favor Carriage
will arrive to take you to Yangxin Hall.
SU PEISHENG
Your Majesty, Lady Shen has arrived.
Carry her in.
Your Majesty.

Attendant Wan is as pretty as a flower,
but she's also as timid as a mouse.

As she lacks resolve,
her beauty is vain and useless.
CONSORT QI

She saw that bloody scene when she was
new here. Of course she's scared.

You should know very well how arrogant
Consort Hua has become.
On the day she came to visit me,

even though you're
the Third Prince's mother,

you greeted her
before she greeted you.

Your Highness, the Third Prince
is not His Majesty's favorite.
And His Majesty isn't fond of me.
I'm growing old.

But Consort Hua is young and pretty.
She also has the Nian family behind her.

My own First Prince and the late Empress's
Second Prince both died young.
Now the Third Prince is the eldest son.

You have higher status than Consort Hua.
She has not given birth to a child.
What you say may be true,

but His Majesty doesn't like
the Third Prince.

If His Majesty doesn't like him,
then you should try to change his mind.
Even you show such weakness.

No wonder the Third Prince
failed to make progress.
Do these flowers please you?

I passed by the greenhouse yesterday,
and saw they had come into full bloom.
So I had them sent to you.

I like them very much.
Thank you, Your Majesty.

I see. There are chrysanthemums
embroidered on your dress.
Why are you so fond of them?

"They would rather die on the branch
retaining their scent
than be scattered on the cold wind."

I love them
because they have integrity.
They do have integrity.

I like them because they're
the only flowers that bloom in fall.

They do not wish
to compete with the others.

Only when you can endure loneliness,
may you enjoy happiness forever.
I've learned from His Majesty.

Changxi Hall. The name sounds
like the study hall of an old scholar.

Since you favor chrysanthemums,
let's rename it Cunju Hall.
My lady, look at those chrysanthemums.

Never in my life have I seen
green chrysanthemums.
They're quite special indeed.

Look, the greenhouse workers
are in such a hurry.

I bet they're delivering them
to our palace.

Since they're gifts for me,
then tell them to stop.

- Let us have a look first.
- Yes, my lady.
Come here.
I greet Consort Hua.

It's due to your efforts
that we may see such rare flowers.
Just put them here.

Consort Hua,
these chrysanthemums–
Speak.
They are to be taken to Cunju Hall.
Then carry out your orders.
Please forgive me, Consort Hua.
Please forgive me, my lady.
Slap yourself.
It's my fault. It's all my fault.

Master, Attendant Wan has been ill
two months and isn't recovering.
XIAO YINZI

Two days ago, I heard Doctor Wen say
she'll need more time to recover.

Her beauty may have been ravaged
by the sickness.
She cannot serve His Majesty.

That's why we've become
the lowest among all the servants.

We should not bury our future
and die with her.
Master, please lead us.

We can't serve you any longer,
young mistress.
What happened? Just tell me.

The Imperial Household Department
just informed me

that Concubine Li of Qixiang Palace
has requested for me to serve her.
I see.

Concubine Li is a kind mistress.
You're fortunate to have this chance.
Huanbi.

- Summon everyone.
- Yes, mistress.
I've been ill for nearly two months.
Commotion is not good for my recovery.

And I don't need
so many servants to serve me.
So I ask you.
If anyone desires to go,

he may receive a final payment
from Huanbi and simply leave.

Let us congratulate Eunuch Kang
and Eunuch Yin.

They've been requested

in her own territory.
You have the Emperor's favor.

She was afraid our strength would grow
to the point that it's hard to control us.
So she had to get rid of one of us first.

Then we would be too weak
to fight against her.

This ink was received from
the Governor of Shandong as a tribute.
This ink stick may be of good quality,

but it can never compare
with those in Yikun Palace.

Do you really plan to do nothing
about Lady Shen's accident?

You saw Consort Hua hold her head high
when she just paid a visit to me.

That means His Majesty
has already made up his mind.

Even if I wanted to do something,
I'm unable to do anything about it.

In any case, we all know
who must be responsible for this.

Sometimes we have to settle a matter
by leaving it unresolved.

p.span: "All good things must come to an end."
Such as the good days when
the late Emperor and I had just met.
I thought my devout prayers
had been heard by the heavens.
God had granted me
the finest man in the world,
and I could remain by his side
as long as I lived.
Perhaps the late Emperor and I
were not made for each other.
It was my destiny
to be selected at audition
and meet the late Emperor in the garden.
It was also my destiny to meet Consort Hua
and Empress Wenyu in my life.
But what is the true destiny of a person?
No one may know
until the end of one's life.
Then how should we live our life?
At this age, I finally understand.
One must believe in destiny,
but never resign oneself to it.
